text.Filling Details: Click to start filling the details. * mark fields are neccessary. For more details click:
text.Alternative way-Tree view: There is an alternative way to view your accounts - using the Tree View.
text.Create New GL Account: This option allows you to create new GL accounts.
text.Create new closure: This option allows you to create new closure.
text.Red asterisk field: Fields with a red asterisk (*) are required. To know more click:
text.Migrate Opening Balances: This form will be used to migrate opening balances. To know more click:
text.Revert this transaction?: Are you sure you want to revert this transaction?
text.Journal entry reverse transaction: A new journal entry has been created to reverse this transaction:
text.Accounts linked to Financial Activities: Accounts linked to Financial Activities are mapped accounts which are needed to do system generating accounting transaction.
text.GLAccount Balances Application: This makes it easier for an organization wanting to move to Mifos to transfer GL account balances (from their existing accounting application or manual system) to Mifos X Accounting.
text.Accounting to journal entries: In Mifos X, you can close accounting to journal entries. Closures can be applied to all branches or to each branch separately. It is important for organizations to close accounting periodically to prevent transactions that affect the accounting books.
text.Journal Entries Transactions: Journal Entries are essentially logs of all the transactions in your organization that have accounting implications.
text.The Chart of Accounts - General Ledger S: The Chart of Accounts - General Ledger Setup allows you to organize your different accounts within Mifos X.
text.Accrues income, expenses and liabilities: Accrues income, expenses and liabilities as on the provided date
text.Journal entries made at the end of accou: Journal entries made at the end of accounting period
text.List of accounts used by the organizatio: List of accounts used by the organization
text.Set or update office-level opening balan: Set or update office-level opening balances for GL accounts
text.List of Financial Activities and GL Acco: List of Financial Activities and GL Account Mappings
text.Advanced search option for journal entri: Advanced search option for journal entries
text.Manual journal entry transactions record: Manual journal entry transactions recorded in a journal
text.Repeats' and 'Repeats every: Note: 'Repeats' and 'Repeats every' cannot not be modified if there are active accounts (JLG Loans, Recurring Deposits etc) dependent on this meeting.
text.Delete clients signature: Are you sure you want to delete this clients signature
text.Unassign Staff client: Are you sure you want to unassign staff for this client
text.No repayments and disbursal: No repayments and disbursal are available for selected client and meeting date
text.User's current location: This will show the user's current location in the app.
text.Welcome page logo from anywhere: This logo will return the user to the welcome page from anywhere in the system..
text.Section Buttons: This section contains user name, user photograph, user settings and sign out button.
text.Shortcut to the frequently accessed comp: This contains shortcut to the frequently accessed components.
text.User Dashboard Component: This will navigate the user to dashboard component.

text.Shortcut accounts screen: Shortcut to chart of accounts screen to add/modify the ledger accounts.
text.Button for individual account: This button will be used for individual accounts, groups and centers
text.Button for accounting department: This button opens the menu to access the system tools required by the accounting department.
text.Dropdown system reports: Dropdown provides access to all types of system reports including the defualt reports provided by the Mifos and system reports that will be developed by the organization.
text.Setup organization including users: This is where the system is setup according to your organization including users, organization, products and templates.
text.Dropdown self service user administrativ: Dropdown provides access to self service user administrative portal, app configuration and task management.
text.Initial setup and application tour: This buttons opens up the configuration wizard to help the user in initial setup and application tour.
text.Navigate system selecting entity: This will allow the user to quickly navigate the system selecting entity while searching makes the navigation more robust.
text.Organization available languages: Organization can select a language here from the available languages here.
text.Choose a theme as per organization will: This will be used to choose a theme as per organization will.
text.User settings and sign out button: This will have logged in user settings and sign out button.

text.elimination of poverty: that aims to speed the elimination of poverty by enabling Organizations to more effectively and efficiently deliver responsible financial services to the worlds poor and unbanked.Sounds interesting?
text.Please retain the value Entity/Person in: Please retain the value Entity/Person in the filename.

text.Launch an alternative view for office hi: This will launch an alternative view which allows you to view the office hierarchy for your organization.
text.Create new offices: This option allows you to create new offices in your organization.

text.Working days and configure behaviour of: Define working days and configure behaviour of payments due on holidays

text.Manage Offices page allows you to create: The Manage Offices page allows you to create, edit and add the offices within your organization.
text.Define what currencies interactions with: This section allows an organization to define what currencies will be used throughout their interactions within the Mifos X system.
text.Ability to manage holidays for individua: The ability to manage holidays for individual offices is a very useful tool for an organization spanning multiple locations.Use this option to customize holidays for each office of your organization.
text.View, edit and/or delete your organizati: With this option, you may view, edit and/or delete your organization's employees.
text.Working days page allows you to define w: Working days page allows you to define which days of the week are working days.
text.This allows you to manage funds associat: This allows you to manage funds associated with loans.

text.To create code,create: To create code, click on create code and enter the code name.
text.Business Date functionality is not enabl: The Business Date functionality is not enabled. If you need that, Go to Global Configurations and enable the configuration
text.To add or remove a task from the Maker-C: To add or remove a task from the Maker-Checker list.
text.Launch a page that create new data table: This will launch a page that will allow you to create a new data table.

text.Create new report: This option allows you to create new report.
text.Add customized reports and edit core rep: You may add customized reports and edit core reports for your organization.
text.Scheduler Jobs can set batch jobs: By using Scheduler Jobs, you can set batch jobs to be completed at regular intervals. From this page you can schedule, modify or delete jobs.
text.Configurations page allows you to furthe: The Configurations page allows you to further customize the way your organization uses the Mifos system.
text.Maker-Checker principle requires every t: The Maker-Checker principle requires every tasks to be completed by two people to reduce the chance of errors and misuse. One person initiates the process and the second completes it.
text.Roles and Permissions allow the administ: Roles and Permissions allow the administrator to control access to Mifos based on what roles are assigned to Users and what Permissions are assigned to roles.
text.Selection you can create new drop-downs: From this selection you can create new drop-downs and edit their values as well as edit the values for system-generated codes and drop-downs.
text.Mifos X data-tables allow the user to ad: Mifos X data-tables allow the user to add custom fields in addition to the built-in fields to a client profile, loan/saving account, group, center or an office.
text.Preferences for generating account numbe: Preferences for generating account numbers for client, loan and savings accounts
text.Global configurations, Cache and Busines: Global configurations, Cache and Business Date settings
text.Manage Schedule and Workflow jobs, modif: Manage Schedule and Workflow jobs, modify jobs or view history and logs
text.Add new report and classify reports: Add new report and classify reports
text.Audit logs of all the activities: Audit logs of all the activities, such as create client, disburse loans etc

text.Supports Loan charges, Savings & deposit: This option allows you to create new charges. It supports Loan charges, Savings & deposits charges and Client charges.

text.Add, modify or inactivate a Recurring De: Add, modify or inactivate a Recurring Deposit product
text.Add, modify or inactivate a Fixed deposi: Add, modify or inactivate a Fixed deposit product
text.Defines rules for taking multiple rules: Defines rules for taking multiple rules
text.Define delinquency day ranges and bucket: Define delinquency day ranges and bucket set for loan products
text.Define charges/penalties for loan produc: Define charges/penalties for loan products, savings and deposit products
text.Add new share product or modify or inact: Add new share product or modify or inactivate share product
text.Add new savings product or modify or ina: Add new savings product or modify or inactivate savings product
text.Add new loan product or modify or inacti: Add new loan product or modify or inactivate loan product
text.Two types of chargesfees and penalties: Mifos supports two types of chargesfees and penalties.Fees are charged for servicesfor example, membership fees, loan disbursement fees, withdrawal fees. Penalties are charged to discourage clients from deviating from the terms of a product
text.Loan products define the rules, default: Loan products define the rules, default settings, and constraints for a financial institution's lending offerings. A loan product provides a template for multiple loan accounts for the financial institution's clients.
text.Savings products define the rules, defau: Savings products define the rules, default settings, and constraints for a financial institution's current/checking and passbook savings accounts. A saving product provides a template for multiple accounts that are or will be held by the financial institution's clients, groups and centers.
text.Share products define the rules, default: Share products define the rules, default settings, and constraints for a financial institution's Shares and dividends. A share product provides a template for multiple accounts that are or will be held by the financial institution's clients.
text.Fixed Deposit Products defines the rules:
Fixed Deposit Products defines the rules, default settings, and constraints for a financial institution's
fixed deposit offerings (also referred to as term deposits). A fixed deposit product provides a template for multiple fixed deposit accounts for the financial institution's clients.
text.Recurring Deposit products define the ru: Recurring Deposit products define the rules, default settings, and constraints for a financial institution's recurring deposit offerings (a type of term deposit with recurring deposits). A recurring deposit product provides a template for multiple recurring deposit accounts for the financial institution's clients.

error.Filling Details: Click to start filling the details. * mark fields are neccessary. For more details click:

tooltips.Name of the loan product: The name of the loan product that the loan account is based upon
tooltips.Financial institution representative: The financial institution representative who has responsibility for, and interacts with, the client/group associated with a loan account
tooltips.Provides an indication: Provides an indication of how the funds provided through the loan will be directed and can be used to group loans with the same purpose for reporting
tooltips.Date the loan account application: The date the loan account application was received
tooltips.Date that the loan account disbursed: The date that the loan account is expected to be disbursed
tooltips.Provides an external id: Provides an external id for the loan account
tooltips.May be entered to override: May be entered to override the date the system would schedule
tooltips.Fields are input to calculating the repa: These fields are input to calculating the repayment schedule for a loan account and are used to determine when payments are due.
tooltips.May be entered to override the date: May be entered to override the date the system would start charging interest
tooltips.The Interest method value: The Interest method value is input to calculating the payments amount for repayment of the loan.
tooltips.The Amortization value: The Amortization value is input to calculating the repayment amounts for repayment of the loan.
tooltips.Daily - Will Calculate the interest: Daily - Will Calculate the interest on DAILY basis ex: Month of February has 28days and it will calculate interest for 28days, SAME AS REPAYMENT PERIOD- it calculates for the month,that is, 30days.
tooltips.To be used with SAME AS REPAYMENT PERIOD: To be used with SAME AS REPAYMENT PERIOD- for  calculating exact interest with partial period  ex: Interest charged from is 5th of April , Principal is 10000 and interest is 1% per month then the interest will be (10000 * 1%)* (25/30) , it calculates for the month first then calculates exact periods between start date and end date(can be a decimal)
tooltips.With Arrears tolerance: With 'Arrears tolerance' you can specify a tolerance amount and if the loan is behind (in arrears), but within the tolerance, it won't be classified as 'in arrears' and part of the portfolio at risk.
tooltips.If the Interest Free Period: If the Interest Free Period is '4' and the client's Repayment Frequency is every week, then for the first four weeks the client need not to pay interest, he has to pay principle due for that week only.
tooltips.The repayment strategy: The repayment strategy determines the sequence in which each of the components is paid.
tooltips.The moratorium information: The moratorium information will default from the loan product settings, but can be changed for this loan account
tooltips.The interest rate chart: The interest rate chart provides the information required to calculate the interest payable on a fixed deposit account based on the fixed deposit product.
tooltips.The minimum length of time: The minimum length of time the funds must remain in the fixed deposit account to earn the full interest income.
tooltips.A period of time during which a fixed de: A period of time during which a fixed deposit account based on this fixed deposit product will be locked-in after it is opened.
tooltips.After the minimum deposit term has passe: After the minimum deposit term has passed, additional deposit durations may be specified.
tooltips.The maximum length of time funds: The maximum length of time funds may be deposited in a fixed deposit account based on this fixed deposit product.
tooltips.This sections defines an interest penalt: This sections defines an interest penalty for pre-mature closure.
tooltips.An boolean flag to attach: An boolean flag to attach  taxes to interest posting
tooltips.The minimum deposit amount required to o: The minimum deposit amount required to open a fixed deposit account based on this fixed deposit product.
tooltips.The default deposit amount expected: The default deposit amount expected when a fixed deposit account based on this fixed deposit product is opened.
tooltips.The maximum deposit amount allowed when: The maximum deposit amount allowed when a fixed deposit account based on this fixed deposit product is opened.
tooltips.The period at which interest rate: The period at which interest rate is compounded.
tooltips.The period at which interest rate is pos: The period at which interest rate is posted or credited to a fixed deposit account based on this fixed deposit product.
tooltips.The method used to calculate interest: The method used to calculate interest.
tooltips.The setting for number of days: The setting for number of days in year to use to calculate interest.
tooltips.Unique name for the floating rate scheme: Unique name for the floating rate scheme.
tooltips.Base lending rate for the organisation: Check if this floating rate scheme is to be considered base lending rate for the organisation
tooltips.Floating rate scheme to be activated: Check if this floating rate scheme to be activated
tooltips.Floating interest rate and start date: Floating interest rate and start date for this floating rate scheme
tooltips.Interest rate mentioned is added to base: If checked, Interest rate mentioned is added to base lending rate as of the from date of this period, absolute otherwise
tooltips.Enter multiples of currency value: You can enter multiples of currency value. For example, if you put multiples of 100, the currency value will be rounded off to 200, 300, 400, etc.
tooltips.Number of decimal places to be used to t: The number of decimal places to be used to track and report on loans.
tooltips.The currency in which the loan will be d: The currency in which the loan will be disbursed.
tooltips.Product name is a unique identifier: The product name is a unique identifier for the lending product.
tooltips.Short name is a unique identifier: The short name is a unique identifier for the lending product.
tooltips.Loan products may be assigned: Loan products may be assigned to a fund set up by your financial institution. If available, the fund field can be used for tracking and reporting on groups of loans.
tooltips.A borrower loan counter (cycle): A borrower loan counter (cycle) is used for tracking how many time the client has taken this particular product.
tooltips.loan product will be active and availabl: The date that the loan product will be active and available to clients. If blank, the loan product will be active as soon as it is created.
tooltips.loan product will become inactive and un: The date that the loan product will become inactive and unavailable to clients. If blank, the load product will never become inactive.
tooltips.Provide additional information: The description is used to provide additional information regarding the purpose and characteristics of the loan product.
tooltips.NPA (non performing asset) once the numb: A loan is a NPA (non performing asset) once the number of days entered into this field is exceeded. If this field is blank, the loan will be an NPA the day after a scheduled payment is missed.
tooltips.Fields are used to define the minimum, m: These fields are used to define the minimum, maximum gap that should be present between the installments for the loan product
tooltips.Loan Product can be used to apply for To: If selected, the Loan Product can be used to apply for Topup Loans.
tooltips.Leave this checkbox unchecked: Leave this checkbox unchecked if the loan is a single disburse loan. Check this checkbox if the loan is a multi disburse loan. See additional fields for additional information required for this type of loan.
tooltips.Maximum number of disbursements: The maximum number of disbursements allowed for a loan account.
tooltips.Maximum outstanding loan account balance: The maximum outstanding loan account balance allowed at a point in time.
tooltips.Specific days before when repayment: Specific days before when repayment due notification should be sent.
tooltips.Specific days when after the repayment O: Specific days when after the repayment Overdue notification should be sent.
tooltips.Fields are used to define the minimum, d: These fields are used to define the minimum, default, and maximum principal allowed for the loan product.
These fields are used to define the minimum, default, and maximum number of repayments allowed for the loan product.
tooltips.Define the minimum, default, maximum, an: These fields are used to define the minimum, default, maximum, and period for the nominal interest rate allowed for the loan product. The minimum, default, and maximum nominal interest rates are expressed as percentages.

These fields are used to define the minimum, default, maximum, and period for the floating interest rate allowed for the loan product. The minimum, default, and maximum floating interest rates are expressed as percentages.
tooltips.Input to calculating the repayment sched: These fields are input to calculating the repayment schedule for a loan account and are used to determine when payments are due.
tooltips.A loan is in arrears once the number of: A loan is in arrears once the number of days entered into this field is exceeded. If this field is blank, the loan will be in arrears the day after a scheduled payment is missed.
tooltips.The currency in which the deposit will b: The currency in which the deposit will be disbursed.
tooltips.Decimal places to be used to track and r: The number of decimal places to be used to track and report on deposits.
tooltips.Description is used to provide additiona: The description is used to provide additional information regarding the purpose and characteristics of the recurring deposit product.
tooltips.The number at which lock in period occur: The number at which lock in period occurs.
tooltips.The number at which minimum deposit occu: The number at which minimum deposit occurs.
tooltips.The number at which multiple deposits oc: The number at which multiple deposits occurs.
tooltips.The description is used to provide addit: The description is used to provide additional information regarding the purpose and characteristics of the chart.
tooltips.The name is a unique identifier for the: The name is a unique identifier for the chart.
tooltips.Track and report saving account: The number of decimal places to be used to track and report on saving accounts
tooltips.Amount to be rounded off: The amount to be rounded off (example: 100 rounds off to 200, 300, 400, etc)
tooltips.A unique identifier for the saving produ: A unique identifier for the saving product
tooltips.Provides additional information: Provides additional information regarding the purpose and characteristics of the saving product
tooltips.Sets the minimum deposit amount: Sets the minimum deposit amount required to open a saving account of this saving product type
tooltips.Used to indicate the length of time: Used to indicate the length of time that a savings account of this saving product type is locked-in and withdrawals are not allowed
tooltips.Indicates whether the withdrawal fee: Indicates whether the withdrawal fee should be applied when funds are transferred between accounts
tooltips.Sets the balance required for interest c: Sets the balance required for interest calculation
tooltips.Sets the minimum balance allowed for a s: Sets the minimum balance allowed for a saving account
tooltips.Indicates whether to enforce a minimum b: Indicates whether to enforce a minimum balance
tooltips.An boolean flag to attach taxes to inte: An boolean flag to attach  taxes to interest posting
tooltips.Indicates whether saving accounts based: Indicates whether saving accounts based on this saving product may have an overdraft
tooltips.Sets the overdraft required for interest: Sets the overdraft required for interest calculation
tooltips.Sets the maximum allowed overdraft amoun: Sets the maximum allowed overdraft amount for a saving account that is allowed to have an overdraft
tooltips.Enables definition and tracking inactive: Enables definition and tracking inactive Savings Accounts
tooltips.Inactive period to mark an account as In: Consecutive Number of Days of inactive period to mark an account as Inactive
tooltips.Inactive period to mark an account as Do: Consecutive Number of Days of inactive period to mark an account as Dormant
tooltips.Inactive period to mark an account as Es: Consecutive Number of Days of inactive period to mark an account as Escheat
tooltips.The default interest rate set: The default interest rate set when creating savings accounts
tooltips.The period at which interest rate is com: The period at which interest rate is compounded
tooltips.Interest rate is posted or credited to a: The period at which interest rate is posted or credited to a saving account
tooltips.To calculate interest: The setting for number of days in year to use to calculate interest
tooltips.Track and report on share accounts: The number of decimal places to be used to track and report on share accounts
